name: Jim
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
First and foremost, this place was clean and was stocked with anything we would need. There were even extra condiments and leftover groceries in the fridge. For me, those things are incredibly important and they were absolutely done well.
If I have one small piece of feedback, it would be the lack of TV options. We obviously didn’t stay there to watch TV, but in the evenings it’s always nice to have something on, and unfortunately there were only 5 local channels. In order to access anything else, you need an Apple ID and an iPhone. Even if you did have an iPhone, it was still challenging to get everything hooked up and working, and you had to have your own logins to anything (Netflix, Hulu, etc).
In short, most places I have stayed in have either had cable provided or a Netflix account, which would bypass the need for an iPhone and special account logins.

name: Jeanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was the second time our family stayed at this cottage. It is very comfortable and feels like being at home. The location is very good. There isn't any noise in the neighborhood, you can see the lake from the front window, and it is close to everything in Lake Winona and Warsaw. The cottage is well stocked with everything you could need when away from home. One of our favorite parts of the cottage is the super cute kitchen. The appliances are very nice (so are the washer & dryer) and the kitchen made me want to cook meals. Also, the mattresses are great! We slept so well while we were there.
The only thing that was a bit of an issue is the Apple TV system. We are not familiar with Apple TV so we had issues getting used to the TV. The remote for the Apple TV also has to be plugged into a charger to work (was that way a year ago, too). It's a little annoying to have to have the remote over on the bar plugged into the charger when you are sitting on the couch wanting to change the channel. It's not a big deal, just a bit inconvenient.
Overall, my family would highly recommend this cottage when you need a place to stay in the Warsaw area.

,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is a great place to stay! This cute duplex looks upon a really quiet residential neighborhood and the stunning Winona Lake. The duplex is spotless. I really appreciated the heater in the bathroom, the neutral/soothing bedding, and nicely decorated bedrooms. The kitchen was well stocked for just about anything you'd want to make. Communication is top notch. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to any of my friends and family. It's proximity to Winona Lake is definitely a plus and Warsaw is easily accessible. It's also close to the Kosciusko Fair Grounds which is great for attending the yearly Fair or 4th of July Fireworks.
Things worth mentioning: There is a nearby Foundry and railroad track which can cause some vibrations to be felt in the house. It wasn't a big deal and there weren't any noises or weird smells.
Access to off street parking is behind some commercial buildings off Winona Avenue. Since it's behind the buildings, vehicles aren't viewable from Winona Avenue. I'd say there's enough room for two vehicles on rental's side of the parking pad. There's space for one vehicle in front of the house.
The house has a shower (no tub) so that might be helpful to know for parents of young children.

review_text: We loved our stay! The decor is just as pictured. Lots of great small touches extra chargers and cords for phone and Apple Watch. Apple TV made it easy to just screen mirror from our phones to watch our own subscriptions. Brought our bikes and biked on multiple paved trails nearby. Close to the small beach lake access point to get some sun. Really close to Kroger. Loved all the kitchen amenities and had coffee on the front porch before it got too hot. Comfortable bed and felt very clean. Heater in bathroom is a nice touch. Look forward to staying again. Loved the Port Wine shop (they offer wholesale wine so it’s cheaper options and bottomless mimosas $20) Their decor at the wine shop is soooo cute. The cheese ball so good, best blue cheese olives we’ve ever had, and super friendly staff/owner. Also tried the boathouse for dinner just ok for the pricing. Had drinks at Mad Anthony Brewery downtown good local feel and really nice staff. Wanted to try the One Ten place that was recommended but didn’t realize they took reservations and were fully booked. Looked really cute and had a nice outdoor seating area. Look forward to trying other places on our next visit. Thank you!

We’re a group of 7 girls that stayed who all have phones and computers, who wanted to be able to use social media to post about our weekend, download movies to watch, and to play streaming video games on my Nintendo switch. The very slow internet speeds made this difficult for us. If you don’t mind the internet speeds, then this place is perfect for you :)

review_text: The PRO's, close to the lakefront beach, a few local eateries, and 10min drive from the Winona Lake Trails which was AWESOME and recommended by our host. The condo was VERY luxurious and we felt right at home. The only few downsides which are out of the control of our host were: the street noise to due some motorcycle groups that revved up their bikes insanely high, No TV's in the bed rooms so you will go to sleep fast, and the dang freight trains that rolls through town at 1, 3, and 5am. Not sure if the train companies hate Warsaw, but they get on that horn and it will wake you up if you're a light sleeper. However, the place is AWESOME and the price was so worth it! I would recommend this host and her place to anyone.

We had everything we needed to make meals, a small coffee maker and a couple snacks were left for us. There were little extras in the bathroom too, in case we forgot something. Very thoughtful:) Having a washer and dryer in unit was really convenient. Plenty of extra pillows, bathrobes...I could go on. Amy obviously pays attention to detail. Parking is easy (we always had a space out front) and the building itself was easy to find and enter. Plenty of restaurants nearby in this charming neighborhood. I highly recommend!

Love, love, love Amy’s Lux Loft in downtown Warsaw. I felt at home as soon as I walked through the door. Checking in was a breeze and the loft has a well stocked kitchen, the bathrooms are clean and the shower head in the master bath was divine, and the bed……….so very comfortable……….and, there is a white noise machine in the master which is awesome because I’m accustomed to sleeping with some sort of white noise.
With its downtown location it provides the opportunity to walk to many places.
Warsaw is my hometown and my Mother, sisters, brothers, aunts and cousins all live there. I plan to stay at Amy’s Lux Loft the next time I travel to Warsaw.

review_text:
This is an outstanding place. Location can’t be best. Condition is great, everything appears to be brand new. It’s bigger than it looks in the photos, tons of space. Immaculately clean. Very well stocked in terms of both kitchen and bathroom amenities. Nice furniture, very comfortable beds. Genuinely beautiful apartment.
As mentioned in the description, it’s a walk up, and no parking, but neither is a big deal. We parked directly out front and there were dozens of empty spots within a couple blocks. (It’s downtown Warsaw, you know - there’s infinite parking). As for the walkup, there were maybe 20 steps. We had our kids and a lot of luggage and it was no issue.
I would stay here again if it were in any city. Considering the mediocre hotel options in Warsaw it’s an extraordinarily good option and terrific value.

name: Deborah
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Loved the house and the location!! This was my first visit to Winona Lake and I will definitely be back! Because it is a small town, you will want to check on the hours of any store or restaurant in the area. If not busy they will close early. Cerulean is a great, local restaurant and the staff is amazing! The cocktails served in the bar are custom elixirs and well thought out for the palette! Goat Cheese and Pepper Jelly with Toast Points is a wonderful starter. I would also recommend popping into the Port Winona Wine & Market. They have Wine, Craft Beers in a Can, and lunch selections. I had the Caprese Pasta Salad and a glass of Peach Sangria then took a seat on the porch. The best part of the day though is the Sunsets!!! Do not miss this on a nice day!! The colors off the beach are incredible. If you are bringing family, there are Pontoon Boat and Kayak Rentals at the Boathouse, but you will want to reserve in advance on holiday weekends. Cannot say enough! Loved It!

review_text: Wow. I have no comparison as this was my first Airbnb experience, but let's just say this one would be hard to beat! It is clear that Charlene and Greg put lots of love in the design and care of this truly delightful home. Comfortable and amazingly clean, filled with lots of thoughtful touches like a jar of lemon drops on the writing desk, an umbrella just in case, brochures for local attractions and so much more. The location is amazing - in the center town, overlooking a gorgeous park and pond with a fountain, an easy walk to fabulous dining, shopping, and outdoor activities. Winona is a completely charming town with lots to do, ideal for families or couples. Charlene is a most friendly, accommodating hostess, making an otherwise first-rate experience over-the-top! Wow.

Instead of staying in Warsaw, we opted to stay in Winona, which is only five minutes from the theatre. So glad we stayed here! It’s a beautiful little town with two parks right on Lake Winona . We rented both suites. One for my parents and one for my husband, daughter and me. They were exactly as pictured; super adorable, spacious, clean with a great view of the park. Also, it’s walking distance to pretty much anything in the town, including the lake. Greg and Charlene were great hosts and even left water for us upon arrival. We enjoyed our stay very much! Highly recommend these suites!

review_text:
My husband and I visited the Guesthouse on Terrace in late March of 2019. We enjoyed a relaxing 3 night stay in Guesthouse A (which had the larger King sized bed).
The tasteful decor and nautical details were in tune with the theme of an ideal lakeside retreat. If you love taking in the outdoors, their back patio is the perfect spot to read a book or just gaze out and appreciate nature at its finest. We also enjoyed the locally made hand soap in the bathroom that smelled divine!
Winona Lake and the Village shops at Winona were a mere 8 minutes away from the Guesthouse, thus making it easily accessible by foot to go around and explore this beautiful town.
We’re hoping to come back in the summer months when the town is more active and alive. Check out the Guesthouse on Terrace. It’s absolutely worth booking.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This was a nice upstairs apartment. The space was tidy and clean and located in a nice area of town with a very short walk to a small park. The price is definitely reasonable for what you get. I would give a 5 star review BUT…it’s not suitable for 8. It’s not even suitable for 6. While there’s plenty of space in the apartment, it is not properly furnished. 2 queen beds and a futon realistically can only sleep 6 (our party of 6 had some on the floor because the futon is small). Also, the living room only has a futon for seating. 3 can sit, which means everyone else is on the floor. Again, clean space at a good price (and you even get a bottle of wine), but you might consider bringing folding chairs and sleeping bags.

review_text: Jonathan was extremely helpful and kind with my questions before and during our stay. Everything was clean and well kept. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was because the Airbnb was described as a whole house, and it felt a bit misleading. There are the components of a whole house (kitchen, bathroom, bedrooms, living areas, etc), but the actual “house” was divided up into 2 , maybe 3 apartments total. We could hear some noise from either television or people talking in the apartment below and we also felt weird playing our music/watching tv because we didn’t want to disrupt them as well. Jonathon was super helpful and informative about the Airbnb in all other areas, I just feel like this could have been better explained in the description.

The Winona Lake police were able to come very quickly after we reached out to them for help, and they got me back into my car in less than a minute! Amazing town and a WONDERFUL Airbnb stay!

review_text: Right on the alley and surrounded by houses making it a little tight. Large back yard, and deck. Very nice house. Loved the kitchen. Couple of extra spices such as garlic and onion would be helpful, as well as lids for the pans. I should've inquired as to the types of pans as we do not like to cook in non stick. We would've brought our own. Bedroom was just right. Bed fairly comfortable. I didn't like that the laundry room was steps from bed so strong detergent smell was present. Some folks are sensitive to strong smells. Living room was nice and comfortable. Bathroom is very small but nice, a bigger person would have a hard time getting around in it. Amenities listed but not available; conditioner, shower gel, missed the cooking oil I guess. Beach, lake and scenic view are close by but not available from house. We walked to canal and lake from Social(yummy ice cream), 1/2 mile away. Views are amazing! David was very prompt to answer my questions. We enjoyed our stay, not enough time!

review_text:
Beautiful little home close to walking trails and the lake. The quality of the build/remodel is evident, and the furniture and finishings are so nice. Bed and sofa are both very comfortable; everything felt brand new. The restroom was modern and clean, but it’s a tight fit with the toilet. I did okay but a large person would have trouble. The complimentary bottle of wine was a fun surprise, and there’s a little coffee pot and things for coffee. The kitchen is decently equipped for a newer listing, but no spices yet. The house is tucked away in an alley behind the larger houses. It was just fine in such a lovely neighborhood but the house across the way was under construction. So sleeping in and afternoon naps and sitting on the front porch were problematic some days. Social Ice Cream Shop was worth the daily walk for AMAZING ice cream!
David and his property will quickly be a Superhost listing. I look forward to staying again - especially when the construction is complete.

Review
We had a fantastic time at Eagle Creek!
Everything was so cozy and convenient and perfectly placed. The house is absolutely stunning and has every single thing we needed. You can tell this host is extremely thoughtful about everyone’s needs.
The property is so charming with the train and creek right behind.
We brought up our kayaks and kayaked for hours through the creek… it was wonderful. 👌🏼
We could not have asked for a better weekend getaway and better host.
No complaints, whatsoever.
We will be back, for sure!!! 😘

name: Jen
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2024
,
·
Group trip
review_text: Stephen was hands down thee best Host of a vacation rental I've ever had. He was extremely responsive and friendly. The house was easy to find and looked exactly as pictured. It worked well for our group staying to celebrate graduation. It's location was great for the University/restaurants etc. The house was well equipped for cooking and hosting a group. Bedrooms were comfortable and all had bathrooms which was great. Just a few negatives. 1.) The house had well water and had a very strong smell/taste. 2.) There is a train track approx. 100 feet from the back of the house where several trains went by daily. That being said it didn't really bother us or keep us up. 3.) Some of the bathroom fixtures/vanities/ etc. were a bit dated and shabby. Maybe time for a refresh. The glass door on the showerin the loft bedroom didn't slide well and the showered has seen better days. In spite of these few negatives the house was great. We enjoyed our time there and would recommend it. Stephen thanks

The back deck is lovely, had a great time watching and listening to the wildlife. Our time spent in this space making memories was magical! Simply the BEST!
Train Note: No one in our party was bothered by the humming of the passing trains, it added to the experience. Stephen did have cute little earplugs packs available if needed, but we didn't. :)

review_text:
The pictures don’t lie, this is a beautiful, tasteful, cozy place to spend your time. There are thoughtful touches throughout. You are right on the creek, and surrounded by trees even though you’re at the end of a regular neighborhood block with easy access to Warsaw. It’s the best of both secluded and easy-commutes. Stephen is a very attentive and kind host and when a problem popped up, glue was very quick to handle it. I would easily recommend this spot to friends. The only hiccup would be stairs, but that’s clear from the photos.
If you’re a train enthusiast, this place is even better because the tracks are across the creek.
We have kids with sensory issues so I was wondering how they’d handle this place, but the house is quiet, and a lot of the things Stephen added made that even better.
And, our dog loved being able to hang out with us, too.

The location was a short drive to Winona Lake and other esteemed Warsaw restaurants. We loved all the restaurants and shops we visited.
As a host, Stephen was also very friendly and communicative. Our checkin process was easy, and all his instructions were thorough.
Would definitely recommend staying with him if you’re looking for a getaway in the Warsaw/Winona Lake area. We can’t wait to go back!

name: Michael

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were in town for my mother's funeral, and my family and I wanted a relaxing, quiet retreat where we could be together at times and yet have our own private spaces when needed. This condo exceeded all expectations. It was beautifully done, with stunning views and the high ceilings and multiple levels made it seem enormous. Our one regret is that the weather was too cold (single digits with wind chill in the negative teens several days) that we couldn't use the rooftop deck to enjoy the 360 degree views of the downtown and surrounding area. We'll save that for another trip when weather is warmer, as we will be back for visits with family and this will be our first choice for accommodations. Several very good restaurants within a block or two, and a nice coffee shop (Courthouse Coffee) right next door at street level. Rebecca was a terrific host - very responsive and compassionate - we could not have asked for more.

It is a restored Mason Hall or building, with beautiful wood work. Couch in living room was great for all of us to talk and lounge. She left lots of nice snacks and lots of coffee pods. Nice beds, linens, and towels. I give it a 5 star review. Now, just one really picky point . . . you cannot use the tap water for coffee. So, it would have been nice if the host would leave a bottle of water you can use for your 1st morning of coffee. There is an awesome restaurant right downstairs, farm to table. Great food and service. also, a coffee shop below. We will definitely stay again if back in Warsaw.

The place had everything I needed, kitchen, washer and dryer etc. Everything was super new and clean. I had a couple of small glitches while I was there but Rebecca couldn't have been more responsive. For some reason the door code was never emailed to me but Rebecca responded right away and I had no trouble getting in. There is plenty of space for a family - I think you could possible fit 6 people but it was only me so I had plenty of space!! I highly recommend!

There were lots of unused products and toiletries left either by the host or previous guests for future guest use, which was really nice and convenient. There were a couple of nit-picky things specific to the kitchen, such as only one frying pan in the entire kitchen and no toaster. Overall an incredibly positive experience! I would highly recommend staying here, and I would absolutely stay here again.

The place was huge! So many fun places to hang out and everything was so comfortable and perfect! There is a beautiful roof top deck with a view of the cute city and lake.
The hosts were great! Welcoming, responsive and left lots on info on the area. They even had a cute little snack basket waiting for us when we checked in!
We loved our stay here, would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone going to Warsaw!

The ceilings must be well over 10' and the windows make you feel like you're outdoors. The loft space is great to tuck your kids away in the evening for a romantic evening alone. I hesitated to write this review because I'd like to keep it secret for our weekends when we visit family in the future. Sadly, I'll tell you the reader this is the best place in town, don't bother with hotels as they don't come close to the accommodations of this place offers.

It had everything we needed to cook our own meals. We enjoy cooking and trying new things. We were able to do that there. Rob had prepared an outdoor fire with wood already to go. We just had to light it and enjoy. We did. We celebrated our 36th anniversary at The Pass. It was just perfect! Everyday we were there we used the trail behind the house to go for a walk. We enjoyed that as well. There were sculptures along the walking trails. Those were nice. The lake is beautiful. We hadn't seen a cleaner lake in awhile.
The whole package just made our stay at Randa's and Robs. We will be back.

name: April
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We HIGHLY recommend Randa & Rob’s Off the Beaten Pass cottage! This was our first time in the Winona Lake area and ALSO our first time using air bnb. We did not know what to expect so when we showed up to this absolutely adorable home, we knew we hit the jackpot of hosts. If you love attention to detail, you will enjoy EVERY perfectly placed detail here. From opening the door and smelling a meticulously clean, neat and organized home to the personalized touches such as a welcome board with our names and a sweet message to greet us, we were incredibly impressed. There are guides with local information, plus, Randa was available and so hospitable to answer all of our questions and share how to make the most of our weekend. We do not have anything to compare this air bnb too, but I’m afraid Randa & Rob have set the bar very high for any future air bnb hosts we use! The only thing that would make our experience better is for Randa to do a consultation on how to stage and decorate our own home in Annapolis Maryland! This property sits next to a beautiful and convenient paved trail that is a short walk to the Village of Winona and Grace College. We were visiting Grace College and this is better than any hotel stay we could have chosen, so close and one of the most well thought out use of spaces. There were only two of us but our family of 5 would have been able to stay very comfortably. Choose Off the Beaten Pass and you will not be disappointed!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Randa and Rob were fantastic hosts. They have earned their designation as “Super Hosts” with Airbnb. The entire process went very smoothly. Rob and Randa are remodeling a property next to the cottage in which we were staying. The gave us our space and privacy but did meet with us to ensure we had no problems and had everything we needed. They were friendly, welcoming and informative.
The cottage was beautifully decorated and contained everything we needed to make our stay restful and enjoyable. There were so many little touches that both added to the aesthetic beauty of the cottage and its utility.
Lake Winona is a charming lake community with parks, beaches, trails and interesting shops. The town of Warsaw has a historic district which includes an impressive county courthouse. We hiked several miles of the “Heritage Trail” which runs within a few feet behind the cottage. Whether you want to relax or play, there is something for everyone.
I recommend the hosts and the property to anyone. We absolutely loved our stay.

Convenient parking is at the front porch and the Heritage Trail is close to your back door for awesome hiking or biking. It's just a short walk to the Winona Village as well as the gorgeous lake. The owners are so kind and ready to assist with anything, but you may not have any needs as they have already provided so much. Enjoy this very nice spot to get away.

We loved it so much we stayed an extra day! If you're looking for relaxation, everything you could ever need already stocked in the house, beautiful sights, a grocery only 10 minutes away by bike, trails, swans, a cozy fireplace, an amazing bonfire, awesome artful touches throughout, black squirrels, and the friendliest trail walkers ever, this place is for you. We cannot emphasize this enough, leave your car parked and take to foot or bike! Off The Beaten Pass is a healing space. Leave your tech on the table and hit the trails. Come back to a fire, a movie, a good book, and peace. Thank you Randa & Rob!!

review_text: I was traveling with 3 other colleagues on a work trip to visit Grace College in Winona Lake. Amy was very communicative and even messaged us that we could check in at any time since the house was clean. Amy provided local dining recommendations and her favorite dishes on a print out at the Airbnb. We went to Cerulean and it was delicious! Prior to booking, I hadn't paid much attention to the size of the home. It is pretty tight and you can definitely hear others moving around in the hallways or going to the bathroom since the door is a little squeaky. The home is also close to a fire station, so it can be a little bit noisy if you are a light sleeper. The home is decorated nicely, clean, and updated. We enjoyed being able to watch a movie on the tv as there was a guest account on their streaming service. This home is within walking distance of a Kroger and only a 7 minute drive from the adorable town or Winona Lake.

Lots of great amenities in this Airbnb; always clean upon arrival, kitchen is well stocked with everything you need (and I cook 3 meals a day in it), lots of seating (enough for 6 comfortably), the bathroom is nice, the beds are super comfortable, there’s covered parking for 1 vehicle, check-in and check-out are easy. Amy is GREAT, very accommodating, easy to reach out to. We have stayed at this Airbnb twice, it’s our go-to for Warsaw. We’ll be back in May!!

name: Kathi
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We loved staying at Amy's beautiful and comfy place! It was very clean and the location was perfectly situated to be close to our family living in Warsaw. We especially liked the comfortable and well-appointed living room and kitchen area. The sofa was especially comfortable and the kitchen had plenty of dishes and pots and pans stocked to be able to prepare meals while staying there. We also appreciated all of Amy's extra touches - the snacks and treats, the variety of coffees and teas, extra towels, laundry detergent available- all to make our stay that much more pleasant! We used the washer and dryer once and it worked beautifully. The memory foam bed was too soft for us but the beds in the two other bedrooms were very comfortable! We had one small issue at the beginning of our stay but Amy responded quickly and made sure to have the problem remedied beyond our satisfaction. She is an exemplary host and went above and beyond to make our stay a pleasant one! Two other things: I noticed that one review mentioned that there wasn't a table to eat at but Amy has added a very nice table and two chairs in the living area (and two additional folding chairs are also available in one of the bedroom closets) and she also made sure to have a full length mirror added in one of the bedrooms after I inquired before our stay if there was any other place with a mirror besides the bathroom to be able to do hair or apply make up. Our stay was simply wonderful and we look forward to staying at Amy's place again!

name: Heather
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
April 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Host was very accomodating and responsive. The home was in a good location with easy access to a lot of restaurants and groceries. The home is not really set up well for airbnb, especially a long term rental, in my opinion. There was no kitchen table, just 2 stools at the counter so my family of four had challenges at every meal time. Not a big deal for a night or two but not ideal for a long term stay. Kitchenware was not thought through: missing kitchen staples and a hodge podge of items. I did purchase a few things I needed and left them for the next guests. Small drains and no disposal. Again, fine for short term but a pain for long term. The heat was by far our biggest issue though. The one bedroom gets insanely hot while the rest of the house stayed pretty cold due to how the vents are set up. I purchased deflectors but they didn't work. Won't be an issue for warmer months.

name: Cindy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
What a very nice stay! The over-the-garage apartment was clean, comfortable and well thought out with everything you might need for practicalities and comfort and they go out of their way to provide small touches and amenities to make you feel welcome and cared for.
It is on a corner lot on a well-traveled country road literally in the middle of a cornfield but only 5 minutes from a major grocery and restaurants and 10-15 from the Village shops around Winona Lake. I was there in early October when the field was being harvested until around 9:30 at night by a huge combine. It was interesting to watch. Although the traffic and combine outside could be loud at times, it was quiet and peaceful inside and the bed was nice and comfortable.
I would highly recommend and will stay again the next time I return to Warsaw.

Lots of extra blankets, hangers, towels, and extras are available for guests. The sunroof windows offer lots of light, a view of the countryside & barn while still allowing privacy. We'll have to come back again!

It's a cozy and comfortable space, just right for a solo (or couple) wanting to get away. Anywhere you might want to go in the Warsaw/Winona Lake area is within quick driving distance, and there is a Meijer just a few minutes away in case you might have forgotten to pack something! The space is well-stocked with dishes and cookware, plus complimentary coffee and tea, and everything is clean and tidy. Definitely recommend it for a stay!
